{{also|allés}} ==Cimbrian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|cim|allz|allias}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|cim|gmh|alles}}, {{m|gmh|allez}}, from {{inh|cim|goh|allez}}, {{m|goh|allaz}}, neuter form of {{m|goh|al}}, {{m|goh|all||all}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|alles}}, {{cog|nl|alles}}, {{cog|fy|alles}}, {{cog|got|𐌰𐌻𐌻𐌰𐍄𐌰}}. ===Pronoun=== {{head|cim|pronoun|g=n|masculine|allar|feminine|alla|plural|alle}} # {{lb|cim|7|Luserna}} [[all]] ===References=== * {{R:Martalar1974|alla}} * {{R:Patuzzi}} ---- ==Dutch== ===Etymology=== Genitive of {{m|nl|al}}. May have been influenced by {{cog|de|alles}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/ˈɑləs/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-alles.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|nl|al|les}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|nl|pronoun|cat2=indefinite pronouns}} # {{lb|nl|indefinite}} [[everything|Everything]] ---- ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== Derived from {{m|et|ala}}. ===Adverb=== {{head|et|adverb}} # [[yet]], not before, [[still]], quite recently, [[already]] #: ''Kas '''alles''' ei parandatud seda?'' #:: Wasn't it repaired ''quite recently''? ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|alles}}, {{m|gmh|allez}}, from {{inh|de|goh|allez}}, {{m|goh|allaz}}, neuter form of {{m|goh|al}}, {{m|goh|all||all}}, equivalent to {{suffix|de|all|es}}. Compare {{cog|nds|[[allns]] ([[Allns]])}}, {{cog|nl|alles}}, {{cog|fy|alles}}, {{cog|got|𐌰𐌻𐌻𐌰𐍄𐌰}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈaləs/}} * {{audio|de|De-alles.ogg|Audio}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun|g=m|neuter|alles|feminine|alle|plural|alle}} # {{lb|de|indefinite}} in singular without a noun (usually ''alles''): [[everything]] # {{lb|de|indefinite}} in singular with a noun: [[all]] ([[the]]) (+ singular noun) # {{lb|de|indefinite}} in plural without a noun: [[everybody]], [[everyone]] # {{lb|de|indefinite}} in plural with a noun: [[all]] ([[the]]) (+ pl. noun) Examples: : ''Menschen aus aller Welt'' = people from all over the world (die Welt, ''pl.'' die Welten) : ''Alles ist gut.'' = Everything is fine/okay. : ''Ich wünsche dir alles Gute.'' = I wish you all the best. : ''Jetzt ist er aller Verantwortung frei.'' = Now he is free of all the responsibility. : ''Alle waren total verständnisvoll.'' = Everybody's been so understanding. ====Inflection==== {{de-decl-all}} Usage note: the genitive forms in -n are only used when it modifies a noun (also in the genitive) which has a -s ending in the genitive. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|alles in allem}} * {{l|de|vor allem}} * {{l|de|alles Gute}} * {{l|de|alles Gute zum Geburtstag}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German indefinite pronouns]] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈales/|[ˈɑləs]}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|lb|pronoun}} # [[everything]] ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Determiner=== {{head|dum|determiner form}} # {{inflection of|dum|al||m//n|gen|s}} ---- ==Middle English== ===Etymology=== From {{af|enm|all|-es|pos2=genitive/adverbial ending}}. ===Adverb=== {{head|enm|adverb}} # [[totally]]; [[altogether]] # [[all told]]; [[in all]] # in some way; [[somehow]]; [[at all]]; [[after all]] ====Usage notes==== * Also used as a weak emphatic. ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Pronoun=== {{head|nb|pronoun form}} # {{genitive of|nb|alle}} ---- ==Old High German== ===Adverb=== {{head|goh|adverb}} # [[else]] # [[thoroughly]]
